properties.areaDesc: Flat Tops; Elkhead and Park Mountains
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 2:16PM MST by NWS Grand Junction CO
properties.description:
A quick moving disturbance will bring a quick few inches of snow
to the high elevations of northern Colorado Monday. Light
snowfall is expected to begin late tonight with rates picking up
around sunrise. Brief rates near 1 inch per hour are possible as
the strongest showers move over the area around mid-day. Favored
locations in the Elkhead, Park, and Flat Top Mountains above 8,000
feet could see up to 6-8 inches by Tuesday morning. Light snow
will continue into Monday night before tapering off. Lesser
amounts of 1-3 inches are expected below 8,000 feet.
